instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3558: What is 820-3558? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3588: What is 820-3588? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: a1418 no good <SIGNAL>GPU_SIGNAL</SIGNAL>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3558</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: This case a colleague already had and I have decided to make a new post on my part because I have the same problem, the 3 gpu led is not enabled, in the post it is recommended first to know if it was gpu to turn on the equipment without ram and see If it was beeping, my question if I do not have beeps where can I start to check?

threads.title: a1418 no good <SIGNAL>GPU_SIGNAL</SIGNAL>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3558</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Do you get voltage on all big coils of the board?
Any history fault available?

threads.title: a1418 no good <SIGNAL>GPU_SIGNAL</SIGNAL>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3558</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I have the following voltages present with both on

l7110-1.7v
l7130-1.7v
l7150-1.7v
l8100-0v
l7310-1.35v

It should be noted that the team at one point gave me 4 LEDs but it did not give me an image. I realized that when I put a ram module in the j2500 module the equipment stayed on 2 led. now it only remains on 2 led.

threads.title: a1418 no good <SIGNAL>GPU_SIGNAL</SIGNAL>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3558</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: The team only gave me 1 led and right off the bat, checking the lines, it started to give 2 led without changing any component, I did not have the 5v source but I think I remember 3.

threads.title: a1418 no good <SIGNAL>GPU_SIGNAL</SIGNAL>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3558</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
a1418 no good <SIGNAL>GPU_SIGNAL</SIGNAL>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3558</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: zhinzhizao program, have the schematic for the plate <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3558</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a

threads.title: a1418 no good <SIGNAL>GPU_SIGNAL</SIGNAL>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3558</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I can't find it there.
Are you sure your board isn't <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> instead?

threads.title: a1418 no good <SIGNAL>GPU_SIGNAL</SIGNAL>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3558</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
It is the model, I am that I use the xinzhizao program a lot since it brings all or almost all the schematic. 
t does not let me upload the schematic or the boardview, anyway if they are that I have also downloaded them from the internet. Let's see if you see something that escapes me, thank you

threads.title: a1418 no good <SIGNAL>GPU_SIGNAL</SIGNAL>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3558</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
As I said, is 3588, not 3558.
Please, post accurate information in the future.

Schematic and boardview available on Internet, not just in XZM software.

Do you get L7110/30/50 voltage with just 2 LEDs on?
No need to check the 3 coils, one reading is enough.

Also check <CHIP>U8600</CHIP> outputs level.
